page.title: 02ECOLOGY
page.content: VEGETATION IN THE AREA SUPPORTS A VARIETY OF LIFE. WILD ANIMALS INCLUDE BADGERS, STOATS, HARES, RABBITS, SQUIRRELS AND FOXES. BIRD LIFE APART FROM COMMON GARDEN BIRDS, INCLUDES THE PROTECTED BUZZARD, RAVEN, GROUSE, PEEWIT, JAY, PIED WAGTAIL AND GOLDCREST. WILD FLOWERS GROW IN ABUNDANCE -SNOWDROPS, RED CAMPION, PRIMROSES, CELANDINE, VIOLETS, STITCHWORT, HAREBELLS, GORSE, MIMULUS, VETCH, MUSK MALLOW, HONEYSUCKLE AND FOXGLOVES. THE HEATHER AREA IS USED BY LOCAL BEE-KEEPERS AND PRODUCES A HIGH QUALITY HONEY. FARMERS ARE GENERALLY CONSCIOUS OF THE NEED FOR CONSERVATION DESPITE A DEGREE OF LAND RECLAMATION HAVING TAKEN PLACE DURING THE PRESENT CENTURY.
